content:
You are an expert in Common Sense.
Your task is to answer the following multiple-choice questions.
Think step-by-step to ensure you have the correct answer.
Then, answer the question using the following format 'Action: Answer("[choice]")'  
The parameter [choice] is the letter or number of the answer you want to select (e.g. "A", "B", "C", or "D")
For example, 'Answer("C")' will select the choice "C" as the best answer.
You MUST select one of the available choices; the answer CANNOT be "None of the Above".
Be concise in your response but include any essential information.

Topic: Geography
Question: What is the capital of the state where Johns Hopkins University is located?
Choices:
  A: Baltimore
  B: Annapolis
  C: Des Moines
  D: Las Vegas

Thought: 
Johns Hopkins University is located in Baltimore, Maryland.
The capital of Maryland is Annapolis.
Action: Answer("B")

Topic: Common Sense
Subtopic: Cars & Other Vehicles
Question: What is the most likely completion to the following text?
[header] How to register a car in texas without going to texas [title] Print and fill out form 130-u]. [substeps] On line 14, put your name and address. On line 14a, put the name and address of the person who is registering the car for you.
Choices:
  A: On line 1b, put your zip code. On line 17b, put your departure location.
  B: On line 15a, put the state in which the car is registered. On line 12b, type the address of the car into line 10-1 and hit call.
  C: On line 14a, you will get the ability to keep your plate number, but you will not need it when registering your car. You can only enter your full name and address on the form, and may leave the tag blank or print it out.
  D: Note that this is where the registration renewal forms will get sent, so make sure the person is willing and able to take that action down the line. On line 14b, put the address where the car will be stored or parked.

Answer: C

Rationale:
The question asks for the most likely completion to the text, which describes how to register a car in Texas without going to Texas. The text mentions that the person registering the car will not need to enter their plate number and can leave it blank or print it out. Therefore, the correct answer is C: On line 14a, you will get the ability to keep your plate number, but you will not need it when registering your car. You can only enter your full name and address on the form, and may leave the tag blank or print it out.

The other options do not align with the given text:

A: On line 1b, put your zip code. On line 17b, put your departure location. - This option does not relate to the text.

B: On line 15a, put the state in which the car is registered. On line 12b, type the address of the car into line 10-1 and hit call. - This option is not mentioned in the text.

D: Note that this is where the registration renewal forms will get sent, so make sure the person is willing and able to take that action down the line. On line 14b, put the address where the car will be stored or parked. - This option is not related to the text.
